You always seem to be very angry or upset all the time for some reason, I have no idea why. Saying developers will be held liable for losses if the merge goes wrong is a subtle but innocuous threat of sorts.
Saying a beacon chain sync takes months is also wrong (have you actually ever tried to sync to head?).

author: timbeiko
content: <@813143648471482378> these posts arenâ€™t useful. This server is meant for technical discussion and there really isnâ€™t anything productive that can come out of an exchange framed this way. We will ban you if you keep it up.

author: alexssd7fp
content: While I do agree that this is off-topic, I still think that there should be a place where people can raise their concerns about Ethereum. At the end, they are honest holders that represent a stake in the Ethereum ecosystem.

author: timbeiko
content: <@354681205842771973> sure, there are plenty: reddit, twitter, ethereum-magicians, etc. That said, these high-level conversations, often about topics where the vast majority of the community is already on board with, aren't the best fit for this server, which is focused on discussing the technicals of various areas of R&D related to Ethereum.

author: timbeiko
content: To use The Merge as an example, it's been over 1 year that client teams have started prototyping it and we are months away from shipping it on mainnet. The time for making a case "against PoS" at a technical level was well before now. If you still disagree, that's fine, and there are plenty of places to rally parts of the community on that front, just not the server where everyone who is actually working on it is.

author: timbeiko
content:
But even disregarding the specific topic, stuff like:
> Damn so when pos fails and crashes all the devs are going pull a Luna and blame the users that staked into the platform? Thatâ€™s cold af and show this point once again
just isn't appropriate for this server. It's not actionable, and at best passive-aggressive towards everyone trying to engage in civil discourse here.
